title: git add
content:
This command adds a file to the staging area.
```
git add [file]
```
This command adds one or more to the staging area.
```
git add .
```

title: git apply
content:
Este comando aplica alterações de acordo com o arquivo indicado.
```
git apply [name]
```

title: git branch
content:
This command lists all the local branches in the current repository.
```
git branch
```
This command creates a new branch.
```
git branch [branch name]
```
This command deletes the feature branch.
```
git branch -d [branch name]
```
This command displays the remote branches
```
git branch -r
```
This command displays all branches, local and remote
```
git branch -a
```

title: git checkout
content:
This command is used to switch from one branch to another.
```
git checkout [branch name]
```
This command creates a new branch and also switches to it.
```
git checkout -b [branch name]
```
This command returns to the previous commit state.
```
git checkout HEAD~
```
This command goes to the commit state of the tag.
```
git checkout <tag>
```
This command advances to the next commit state.
```
git checkout $(git rev-list --topo-order HEAD..<current_branch> | tail -1)
```

title: git clone
content:
This command is used to obtain a repository from an existing URL.
```
git clone [url]
```

title: git commit
content:
This command records or snapshots the file permanently in the version history.
```
git commit -m "[commit message]"
```
This command commits any files you've added with the git add command and also commits any files you've changed since then...
```
git commit -a -m "[commit message]"
```

title: git config
content:
This command defines the name of the author that will appear in the commits.
```
git config --global user.name "[name]"
```
This command defines the author's email that will appear in the commits.
```
git config --global user.email "[email]"
```

title: git diff
content:
This command shows the file differences which are not yet staged.
```
git diff
```
This command shows the differences between the files in the staging area and the latest version present.
```
git diff --staged
```
This command shows the differences between the two branches mentioned.
```
git diff [first branch] [second branch]
```
Este comando cria um arquivo com as modificações não comitadas.
```
git diff > [name].patch
```
Este comando cria um arquivo com as modificações não comitadas, incluindo binários e arquivos untracked.
```
git diff --cached --binary > [name].patch
```

title: git fetch
content:
This command removes remote branches that have been deleted in the remote repository.
```
git fetch --prune
```
This command removes local tags that have been deleted in the remote repository.
```
git fetch --prune-tags
```

title: git init
content:
This command is used to start a new repository.
```
git init
```

title: git log
content:
This command is used to list the version history for the current branch.
```
git log
```
This command lists the commit history of the current branch in just one line.
```
git log --oneline
```
This command is used to list the commit history of the current branch formatted in one line.
```
git log --pretty=format:"%C(blue)%an%Creset | %h | %C(yellow)%ad%Creset | %Cgreen%s%Creset %Cred%d%Creset" --date=short
```

title: git merge
content:
This command merges the specified branch's history into the current branch.
```
git merge [branch]
```

title: git pull
content:
This command fetches and merges changes on the remote server to your working directory.
```
git pull [Repository Link]
```

title: git push
content:
This command sends the branch commits to your remote repository.
```
git push -u origin [branch]
```
This command sends the committed changes to your remote repository.
```
git push
```
This command deletes a branch on your remote repository.
```
git push origin :[branch name]
```
This command clean references of the branchs.
```
git remote prune origin
```
This command pushes tag to your remote repository.
```
git push origin [tag name]
```
This command deletes a commit already pushed to the remote repository.
```
git push origin HEAD --force
```

title: git remote
content:
This command is used to check the current remote repository.
```
git remote -v
```
This command is used to connect your local repository to the remote server.
```
git remote add <origin> git@github.com:<user>/<repo>.git
```
This command is used to update the remote repository.
```
git remote set-url <origin> https://<url-remoto>/<seu-repositorio>.git
```
This command is used to remove remote url.
```
git remote remove <name>
```
This command is used to rename remote.
```
git remote rename <nome-atual-do-remote> <nome-novo-do-remote>
```

title: git reset
content:
This command unstages the file, but it preserves the file contents.
```
git reset [file]
```
This command undoes the last commit and moves changes locally to staged.
```
git reset --soft HEAD~
```
This command discards the last commit and its contents.
```
git reset --hard HEAD~
```

title: git restore
content:
This command restores the contents of the file to that of the last commit.
```
git restore [file]
```

title: git rm
content:
This command deletes the file from your working directory and stages the deletion.
```
git rm [file]
```

title: git show
content:
This command shows the metadata and content changes of the specified commit.
```
git show [commit]
```
This command displays the modified files in the current commit.
```
git show --stat
```
This command displays the modified files in the specific commit.
```
git show --stat [commit]
```

title: git stash
content:
This command temporarily stores all the modified tracked files.
```
git stash save [message]
```
This command restores the most recently stashed files.
```
git stash pop
```
This command lists all stashed changesets.
```
git stash list
```
This command discards the most recently stashed changeset.
```
git stash drop
```
This command will show the changes contained in the stash.
```
git stash show stash@{0}
```
This command will show the changes contained in the contents of the files.
```
git stash show -p stash@{0}
```
This command save code changes of the files specifics
```
git stash push -m "stash-message" -- filename1.txt filename2.txt	
```
Este comando grava em um arquivo as alterações não comitadas.
```
git diff > [name].patch
```

title: git status
content:
This command lists all the files that have to be committed.
```
git status
```

title: git tag
content:
This command is used to create tag.
```
git tag [tag]
```

This command is used to delete tag.
```
git tag -d [tag]
```
This command is used to list existing tags.
```
git tag
```
Command to change the tag commit.
```
git tag -f v1.0 4736E13
```
Send the changed tag to remote repository.
```
git push --force origin v1.0
```
Send new tag to remote repository.
```
git push --tags
```
Send deleted tag to remote repository.
```
git push origin :refs/tags/[tag]
```
